label: 権門勢家
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: “gates of power and powerful houses,” an expression used in later Heian-period sources to denote royal and noble households as well as official temples and shrines. Typically their power translated into influence in the countryside over both land and people.
